channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Market Wrap
item.title: Market Wrap: all the leasing and sales activity in and around Sydney

item.description: Tasmania Premier Peter Gutwein has urged the AFL to consider reconfiguring the competition by replacing one of its less profitable clubs with one from the Apple Isle.
item.title: Premier suggests Tasmanian team could replace struggling club

item.description: Claire Edwardes' thoughtfully constructed hour of percussion solos is an intimate delight.
item.title: Online gift conjures potent magic

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVIDSafe app goes live as global COVID-19 cases near 3 million, Australian death toll stands at 83

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: The big four lender released its half-year results ahead of schedule on Monday morning, with profits hit hard by $2.14 billion in charges from fallout from the coronavirus.
item.title: NAB slashes dividend, raises $3.5b in fresh capital as profits plunge

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Melbourne Victory had hoped to secure deals to play games in the Gulf with the likes of Barcelona and Liverpool but the coronavirus pandemic has put that on hold.
item.title: Melbourne Victory puts discussions with Dubai on the back burner

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: state moves to ease COVID-19 restrictions but no changes to rules on schools

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: After a near 13-year absence from the Australian game, the former Socceroo has joined the "Starting XI" panel.
item.title: Mark Viduka to lead FFA's technical advisory panel

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus live updates: One new COVID-19 case in Victoria as state embarks on major testing blitz

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: Some of the state's most prominent doctors have revealed both the stress they're under – and the unexpected upside – in candid accounts of their new working lives.
item.title: ‘Coronavirus sucks’ but there's a silver lining: WA doctors lift the lid

item.dc:creator: Craig Mathieson
item.description: From British celebrities discovering their wartime roots to Australia's male erotic dance industry, SBS thrives off storytelling this week.
item.title: Meet Australia's own Magic Mike: 'I want to sell sex with a story'

item.description: The decision comes on the heels of another ordering judges to end the practice of flogging, replacing it with jail time, fines or community service.
item.title: Saudi Arabia ends death penalty for minors

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: As other states begin to ease some social distancing rules, NSW Premier Gladys Berejiklian has resisted calls to loosen restrictions beyond its plans for a staged return to schools.
item.title: Social distancing rules to continue in NSW with just two new COVID-19 cases

item.description: To some in the GOP, this feels all too similar to 2008, when anger for George W Bush drove Democrats to the polls.
item.title: Nervous Republicans see Trump sinking, and taking Senate with him

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Despite a "long and complex" investigation, nobody has been charged over the brazen shooting of Walid 'Wally' Ahmad at a Bankstown coffee shop in 2016.
item.title: Insufficient evidence to lay charges over Sydney underworld figure's assassination

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: Seven West Media has confirmed it might have another asset sale option to address its debt woes after receiving a non-binding offer from a third party to buy and leaseback its Perth headquarters.
item.title: Debt-ridden Seven West Media receives offer for WA headquarters

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Major footwear retailer Accent Group will shut some of its 522 stores and shift major parts of its business online after digital sales took off during the COVID-19 lockdown.
item.title: Hype DC, Platypus owner to shut stores after big leap in online sales

item.description: The study found clear dividing lines between those who are coping well and those who are suffering under lockdown.
item.title: Accepting, suffering or resisting? How lockdown is affecting Britons

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Maurice Blackburn has launched a class action against Optus after the numbers and addresses of almost 50,000 customers were made public without their consent last year.
item.title: Optus sued over alleged customer privacy breaches

item.dc:creator: Michael Dwyer
item.description: This was raw, gutsy and uplifting stuff to make you leap off the couch and holler.
item.title: Black Sorrows deliver visceral, sweaty magic from an empty room

item.description: Priya and Nades and their Australian-born daughters have spent more than two years in detention fighting their deportation to Sri Lanka. The Federal Court has now ordered the government to pay their legal fees.
item.title: Government ordered to pay $200k in Tamil family case

item.dc:creator: Michael Dwyer
item.description: Musicians say the streaming giant should be paying them properly first up ... say, more than half a cent per play.
item.title: Spotify's new 'tip jar' ... great idea or tokenistic insult?

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: The 90-year-old died of his 'significant injuries' after being hit by an oncoming car while leaving a Sunshine Coast service station early Monday morning.
item.title: Elderly man on mobility scooter struck and killed by car

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: The Chinese ambassador to Australia labelled Scott Morrison's push for an inquiry as "dangerous".
item.title: 'What is needed is global co-operation': Marise Payne slaps down Beijing's boycott threat

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Josh Addo-Carr and Latrell Mitchell may find themselves in hot water following a camping trip on the South Sydney star's NSW north coast property.
item.title: 'Sorry from bottom of my heart': Addo-Carr regrets lockdown gaffe

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Premier Daniel Andrews says results of unprecedented testing 'blitz' will provide the data for decisions on lifting lockdown and opening schools.
item.title: 'Big numbers': Victoria to test 100,000 for virus in next fortnight

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: The major bank's most optimistic forecasts still see the economy shrinking by 3 per cent and unemployment peaking at 11.6 per cent.
item.title: NAB's unsettling coronavirus scenarios range from the severe to the horrific

item.dc:creator: Nicole Precel
item.description: More than 1.13 million people have downloaded the coronavirus tracing app, COVIDSafe, exceeding government expectations.
item.title: More than 1 million download COVIDSafe app

item.description: One charge of attempted indecent assault dismissed but Gold Logie winner still faces seven charges of indecent assault and six of assault against four women.
item.title: Charge dropped in Craig McLachlan indecent assault case

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: The federal government wants you to download an app. Critics say it's a surefire way to get our personal data stolen. Proponents say it will save lives. Here's the detail.
item.title: How does the coronavirus app work?

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: See the full list of workers protected by new rules in Queensland.
item.title: 'Dangerous as a knife': Spitters, coughers risk $13,000 fine

item.description: The coronavirus Great Pause trashed Flora Carbo's plans for a world tour with a new album. Now she's fighting snails and making plans.
item.title: Grounded jazz saxophonist plans to 'dream big' after lockdown

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: The humble video shop broadened our horizons and a Melbourne artist is keen to remind us of that in a new project.
item.title: Reinventing the classic video shop as a home for lost art

item.description: Former Roosters and Panthers hardman Mose Masoe has been released from an English hospital after suffering a career-ending spinal injury in January.
item.title: 'I can't thank you enough': Masoe's tribute after leaving hospital

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: Mohinder Singh appeared at Melbourne Magistrates Court on Monday morning and sat with his head bowed looking at the ground during the short hearing.
item.title: Horror smash truckie may have 'psychiatric condition', court told

item.description: In 1949, in a historic decision, Melbourne was awarded the 1956 Olympic Games, defeating the bid by Buenos Aires by just one vote in the fourth round.
item.title: From the Archives, 1949: Melbourne awarded the Olympic Games

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: A woman claiming to be the mother of the millionaire mortgage broker accused of filming and taunting a dying policewoman on the Eastern Freeway has distanced herself from her son and says the Pusey family are "disgusted" by his alleged behaviour.
item.title: 'We are disgusted': Pusey family distance themselves from son after freeway crash

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: Property portal Domain Holdings says it has received fresh debt facilities from its lenders, waivers on its financial covenants and announced cost cuts in response to COVID-19 as demand for real estate listings falls.
item.title: Domain adds debt facility and cuts staff costs in COVID-19 response

item.description: Coach gives tentative support to concept but says Saints will respect decision of any player who does not want to be part of it.
item.title: Ratten wary of AFL hub health challenges

item.description: The pandemic has turned this niche hobby into something serious: the tinkerers and techies are increasingly stepping in where others have fallen short.
item.title: In US, garage hobbyists fight pandemic with 3D printers

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The Future Fund was impacted by volatility caused by the coronavirus, but its losses were much shallower than many global markets
item.title: Future Fund sheds 3.4 per cent, or $5.7b, in March quarter as COVID-19 hit assets

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The S&P/ASX 200 is moving higher this afternoon thanks to gains in the industrial and healthcare sector. Banks are still dragging.
item.title: ASX up 1.2pc in early afternoon

item.description: When lockdowns were introduced for aged care facilities, the team realised phone calls wouldn’t be effective for Norma.
item.title: How a Perth family's 'language of love' keeps them connected during lockdown

item.description: More than 1 million Australians downloaded the COVIDSafe app within four hours of its launch.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: World No.3 Dominic Thiem has rejected the notion that the top tennis players should chip in to help lower-ranked competitors who are struggling financially due to the pause in tournaments because of the novel coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: 'No tennis player is fighting to survive': Thiem not keen on plan to assist struggling players

item.description: The students should be allowed "to come here and study Shakespeare and the Federalist Papers, that's what they need to learn from America," he said.
item.title: Let Chinese students study politics, Shakespeare, not STEM, says GOP senator

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: A woman is dead and a man remains in critical condition following a violent incident in Perth's north on Sunday afternoon.
item.title: Perth police launch murder investigation after woman dies in northern suburbs

item.description: Jofra Archer has finally found his missing World Cup winner's medal after the England fast bowler revealed he was going "mad" looking for it following a recent house move.
item.title: Archer reunited with his World Cup medal

item.dc:creator: Sherryn Groch
item.description: We're answering your questions about COVID-19 as they hit our inboxes, with regular updates featuring up top.
item.title: What effect does weather have on COVID-19? Your questions answered
